name: 蔡麗珠
objective: This course is to introduce a serials of biomaterials and their functions. Begins from bacterial, plant, and animal cells and the differences between these cell organs. To learn of DNA, RNA, proteins, and enzymes base on their structures and functions. The characters of 20 amino acids and 4 nucleotides will be studied in detail. Carbohydrates and lipids are learned by their specific functions.
schedule:
1. Ch.1 The Foundations of Biochemistry
2. Ch.2 Amino Acids, Peptides, and Proteins
3. Ch.3 The 3-D structure of Proteins
4. Ch.4 The 3-D structure of Proteins
5. Ch.5 Protein Function
6. exam 1
7.  Ch. 5 Protein Function/Ch.6 Enzymes
8.  Ch.6 Enzymes
9. Ch.7 Carbohydrates and Glycobiology
10. Ch.6 Nucleotides and Nucleic acids
11. DNA-base Information Technologies
12. exam 2
13. Ch14. Glycolysis, Gluconeogenesis
14. Ch16. The citric cycle
15. Ch17. Fatty acid catabolism/DNA transcription/ RNA translation
16. Ch18.  amino acid oxidation and the production of urea
17. DNA transcription/ RNA translation
18. final exam
